paragraphs.content: A Psalm or Song for the sabbath day.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A Psalm or Song for the sabbath day.

paragraphs.content: It is a good thing to give thanks unto the LORD, and to sing praises unto thy name, O most High:
paragraphs.contentHtml: It is a good thing to give thanks unto the Lord, and to sing praises unto thy name, O most High:

paragraphs.content: To shew forth thy lovingkindness in the morning, and thy faithfulness every night,
paragraphs.contentHtml: To shew forth thy lovingkindness in the morning, and thy faithfulness every night,

paragraphs.content: Upon an instrument of ten strings, and upon the psaltery; upon the harp with a solemn sound.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Upon an instrument of ten strings, and upon the psaltery; upon the harp with a solemn sound.

paragraphs.content: For thou, LORD, hast made me glad through thy work: I will triumph in the works of thy hands.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For thou, Lord, hast made me glad through thy work: I will triumph in the works of thy hands.

paragraphs.content: O LORD, how great are thy works! and thy thoughts are very deep.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O Lord, how great are thy works! and thy thoughts are very deep.

paragraphs.content: A brutish man knoweth not; neither doth a fool understand this.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A brutish man knoweth not; neither doth a fool understand this.

paragraphs.content: When the wicked spring as the grass, and when all the workers of iniquity do flourish; it is that they shall be destroyed for ever:
paragraphs.contentHtml: When the wicked spring as the grass, and when all the workers of iniquity do flourish; it is that they shall be destroyed for ever:

paragraphs.content: But thou, LORD, art most high for evermore.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But thou, Lord, art most high for evermore.

paragraphs.content: For, lo, thine enemies, O LORD, for, lo, thine enemies shall perish; all the workers of iniquity shall be scattered.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For, lo, thine enemies, O Lord, for, lo, thine enemies shall perish; all the workers of iniquity shall be scattered.

paragraphs.content: But my horn shalt thou exalt like the horn of an unicorn: I shall be anointed with fresh oil.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But my horn shalt thou exalt like the horn of an unicorn: I shall be anointed with fresh oil.

paragraphs.content: Mine eye also shall see my desire on mine enemies, and mine ears shall hear my desire of the wicked that rise up against me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Mine eye also shall see my desire on mine enemies, and mine ears shall hear my desire of the wicked that rise up against me.

paragraphs.content: The righteous shall flourish like the palm tree: he shall grow like a cedar in Lebanon.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The righteous shall flourish like the palm tree: he shall grow like a cedar in Lebanon.

paragraphs.content: Those that be planted in the house of the LORD shall flourish in the courts of our God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Those that be planted in the house of the Lord shall flourish in the courts of our God.

paragraphs.content: They shall still bring forth fruit in old age; they shall be fat and flourishing;
paragraphs.contentHtml: They shall still bring forth fruit in old age; they shall be fat and flourishing;

paragraphs.content: To shew that the LORD is upright: he is my rock, and there is no unrighteousness in him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To shew that the Lord is upright: he is my rock, and there is no unrighteousness in him.
